instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437 smc_lid = 0.5v
threads.message:
All rails present, no chime, no display. Blinking USB stick. Lid is 0.5V.  Tried new DCIN board and flex cable. 
Very little corrosion near C5021.

threads.title: 820-3437 smc_lid = 0.5v
threads.message: With battery only SMC_LID is high.  But still don't chime/boot.

threads.title: 820-3437 smc_lid = 0.5v
threads.message: Trackpad flat cable/connector corroded. Do a PRAM reset with USB keyboard, should bring back chime.

threads.title: 820-3437 smc_lid = 0.5v
threads.message: I notice vcore is 1.7.

threads.title: 820-3437 smc_lid = 0.5v
threads.message: There is no corrosion there, but I connected a new trackpad, keyboard, and new flex.  No chime, only fan spin.

threads.title: 820-3437 smc_lid = 0.5v
threads.message:
No Title

This is the only spot that has any corrosion.

threads.title: 820-3437 smc_lid = 0.5v
threads.message: Well yeah corrosion under the SMC would do this. Also check resistors and traces there.

threads.title: 820-3437 smc_lid = 0.5v
threads.message: So reball that sucker! OK!  I might have a donor.  Will try !!!

threads.title: 820-3437 smc_lid = 0.5v
threads.message:
No Title

Ok, so I put a new SMC (brand new), and still have all the same.  There was only a little bit of spooge on C5021 & R5115-1 (no stuff). Fan spins, CPU gets hot, and ALL_SYS_PWRGD = 3.3V. I did try doing a PRAM reset with a new keyboard and cable (I don't have a usb keyboard).  There was absolutely no other liquid or corrosion anywhere else on the board. Still no chime.

threads.title: 820-3437 smc_lid = 0.5v
threads.message:
No Title

New keyboard, trackpad and cable.

threads.title: 820-3437 smc_lid = 0.5v
threads.message: Brand new SMC does not exist, what did you buy?

threads.title: 820-3437 smc_lid = 0.5v
threads.message: Ha, ha. LOL. OK. Not brand new.  But purchased one for $15 and installed it. It has the same results.

threads.title: 820-3437 smc_lid = 0.5v
threads.message: Kenny Rogers - know when to hold them & know when to fold them.  So I guess it is wise I give up.  LOL.

threads.title: 820-3437 smc_lid = 0.5v
threads.message: & I didn't see any corrosion under the chip.

threads.title: 820-3437 smc_lid = 0.5v
threads.message: Tony those preballed preprogrammed chips with unleaded balls from china on the reel are fakes at least the ones I got.

threads.title: 820-3437 smc_lid = 0.5v
threads.message: So maybe just keep trying different SMC's?

threads.title: 820-3437 smc_lid = 0.5v
threads.message: Where can we get some good ones at?  Where you at the iFixit thing?

threads.title: 820-3437 smc_lid = 0.5v
threads.message: Think it is most prudent to take a known working SMC out of working MacBook to test. Will try this, then order another chip. That will narrow down the variables.

threads.title: 820-3437 smc_lid = 0.5v
threads.message: Just reball the original chip. The one you put on now can come from any random board...

threads.title: 820-3437 smc_lid = 0.5v
threads.message: The original one wasn't working I was supposing. I have a known good working SMC that I am going to try (waiting on stencil from Rossmann).

threads.title: 820-3437 smc_lid = 0.5v
threads.message: Once I confirm the issue, I'll go fishing for a good SMC.

threads.title: 820-3437 smc_lid = 0.5v
threads.message: The old one just had some crap under it. It is most likely fine.

threads.title: 820-3437 smc_lid = 0.5v
threads.message:
I put a working SMC from a working computer and everything is still the same : ( 
CPU gets hot, fan spins and green light.

threads.title: 820-3437 smc_lid = 0.5v
threads.message: Fan spinning Vcore present? Checked corrosion on  clock chip and traces to Y1905?
